chargeHist.descr: Commit Loan Fraud (Value Exceeds $10,000 but does not Exceed $100,000)
Commit Loan Fraud (Value Exceeds $10,000 but does not Exceed $100,000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant John Edward Henricks III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Commit Loan Fraud (Value Exceeds $10,000 but does not Exceed $100,000), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.83.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any sentence currently serving

miscConds.notes: Pay $188,695 in restitution to People's Bank, Plus applicable surcharges.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay $528 court costs including   DE must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.

DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO REPORT TO JAIL TO PROVIDE DNA SAMPLE WITHIN 15 DAYS OF RELEASE FROM PRISON.  
 If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: to extend time for hearing on restitution
Order to extend time for hearing on restitution
Stipulation to Extend time for hearing on restitution

Adjustment Number: 20A 006751,
Payable Number: 64398,
Receipt Number: 20R 003974,
Amount: $20.00

03:16 PM   Defendant John Edward Henricks in court by phone from incarceration in Kentucky, with attorney TW Duffy appearing by phone. Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State recites agreement, states there has been restitution requested of $188,695.  
Atty Duffy states the DE is willing to pay restitution, but states they need to establish the exact amount, requests Probation run concurrent with what the DE is serving now.   

DE is advised of his rights to Preliminary Hearing.  DE waives right to Preliminary Hearing. Court is satisfied with the waiver, finds probable cause to bind the DE over.  Atty Sortedahl states he has just filed an Information identical to the Complaint, but it has not yet come through the interface for filing by the Clerk.  Atty Duffy agrees to proceed without having the Information filed.

Atty Duffy and DE plead No Contest to Count #1.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.
Judge Yackel advises all parties of his relationship to Attorney Duffy, objection waived by all parties.
Court accepts the Plea and finds the DE Guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in. 
The State reports it is in compliance with victim's rights legislation.
Atty Duffy requests the Court accept the joint recommendation of the parties.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT accepts agreement:  Sentence  is withheld:  DE placed on Probation for 3 years, concurrent with any sentence currently serving.  DE ordered to pay $188,695.00 in restitution and pay Court Costs, including Providing DNA sample.   DE ordered to report to Sawyer county Jail within 15 days of release from prison to provide DNA sample.
Restitution is ordered payable to People's Bank Midwest.  Atty Duffy to contact court for scheduling of Restitution hearing about 45 days out in the event Defendant wishes to contest the amount of the Restitution that has been ordered.
Plea hearing set per request of Attorney Duffy's office. Spoke with Jackie via phone to set hearing.-AMA
Plea hearing on July 29, 2020 at 03:15 pm.
Initial appearance on September 8, 2020 at 08:30 am.

11:35AM Defendant John Edward Henricks in court with attorney Erika L Bierma, both appearing by telephone.  Defendant John Edward Henricks in custody in Manchester Federal Prison.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Appearances by telephone through the conference bridge  due to the Supreme Court Order regarding the Public Health Crisis of COVID-19.  Court calls case, recites appearances, and reviews case.  Court quashes warrant.  Atty Bierma makes statement and requests an initial appearance date.  Atty Bierma updates her address.  Court sets.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 8, 2020 at 08:30 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on July 10, 2020 at 11:00 am.

OFF THE RECORD;   11:10 AM Defendant John Edward Henricks not in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls the case,  DEF did not  appear on conference bridge.   Warrant remains active.
Voluntary appearance/Initial appearance on June 29, 2020 at 11:00 am.

As per DA's office and court officer this warrant from 2014 is no longer active.  DA plans to issue new warrant.
Jill/Ryan 5-21-2020 11:08 am.  Dispatch does not have 2014 warrant in the system.
